heroIntro: Welcome to your next chapter in one of Costa Blanca's most peaceful coastal towns. This exceptional 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura offers the relaxed lifestyle you've been dreaming of, priced at €334,500—remarkably, 50% less per square metre than comparable properties in nearby Jávea. Guardamar del Segura has become increasingly popular with retirees and expats seeking authentic Spanish living without the overdevelopment of larger resorts. At just 86 square metres of expertly designed space, this property delivers everything you need for comfortable retirement living: modern finishes, smart layouts, and immediate access to pristine beaches, golf courses, and excellent healthcare facilities. With the Costa Blanca enjoying 320 days of sunshine annually and a thriving international expat community, you'll find it remarkably easy to settle in, make friends, and embrace a slower pace of life. The market here is appreciating at 7% year-on-year, making this not just a lifestyle choice but a sound financial decision.
areaSection: Guardamar del Segura is a charming Mediterranean town of approximately 16,000 residents, located 60km south of Alicante city. Unlike the overcrowded beach destinations of the Costa Blanca, Guardamar has maintained its authentic Spanish character while carefully welcoming an international community. The town sits where the Segura River meets the sea, creating a unique landscape of protected dunes, pine forests, and Blue Flag beaches. The climate is typically Mediterranean—hot, dry summers and mild winters—with winter temperatures rarely dropping below 15°C. The town centre retains genuine Spanish architecture and culture, with a working fishing port, tree-lined plazas, and local restaurants serving fresh seafood. Nature lovers appreciate the protected Dunas de Guardamar natural area, while the proximity to larger towns like Torrevieja (20 minutes away) means bigger shopping and entertainment options are never far away. This balance between peaceful authenticity and convenient access to amenities makes Guardamar especially appealing to retirees.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Guardamar del Segura revolves around relaxation, community, and outdoor enjoyment. Your mornings might start with a paseo along one of the Blue Flag beaches or a coffee at a local café watching fishermen bring in the day's catch. The British and Scandinavian expat community here is well-established but far less visible than in Torrevieja, meaning you'll have genuine opportunities to connect with Spanish culture and locals. The Wednesday market brings fresh produce, local crafts, and community atmosphere to the town centre. For dining, the malecón (beachfront promenade) offers excellent restaurants serving fresh fish and paella, many with English-speaking staff. Healthcare is straightforward—Hospital de Torrevieja (15 minutes away) is modern and well-equipped, with many doctors speaking English. Supermarkets like Mercadona and Consum are within walking distance or a short drive. The pace here is genuinely slower; there's an emphasis on enjoying leisure time, spending time with friends, and appreciating the natural surroundings. It's the kind of place where people actually retire to live, not just to escape.
investmentSection: This property represents intelligent investment for retirees. At €3,890 per square metre, you're acquiring a premium-specification apartment for significantly less than equivalent properties in nearby Jávea. Guardamar del Segura's property market is appreciating at 7% year-on-year, driven by increased demand from international buyers seeking authentic coastal living. Beyond personal enjoyment, the property generates solid rental income—comparable apartments in the area command approximately €700 per week during peak season, providing excellent returns if you choose to rent during periods you're away. The Spanish property market remains fundamentally sound, with increasing interest from European buyers seeking affordability combined with lifestyle quality. Unlike larger resort towns where property values plateau, Guardamar is experiencing genuine growth as discerning buyers discover its authentic character and exceptional value proposition.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura represents a genuine opportunity to transition into the relaxed, authentic Mediterranean lifestyle you've envisioned for retirement. At €334,500 with premium finishes, exceptional location, and immediate access to beaches, healthcare, and a supportive expat community, the value proposition is compelling. The combination of affordable living costs, excellent weather, established social networks, and growing property appreciation makes this more than just a purchase—it's an investment in your retirement quality of life. Whether you plan to live here full-time, split time between UK and Spain, or generate income through seasonal rentals, this property offers flexibility and security. The market is moving quickly as more discerning buyers discover Guardamar's authentic appeal. lifeAndAmenities.intro: Guardamar del Segura provides everything needed for comfortable, independent living. Daily necessities are conveniently accessible, while larger cities remain nearby for specialized services. The infrastructure supports both Spanish residents and international expats, with many service providers speaking English.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Guardamar del Segura is excellent and accessible. The nearby Hospital de Torrevieja (15 minutes) is a modern, well-equipped facility with English-speaking doctors and specialists. Guardamar has a local centro de salud (health centre) providing general practitioner services, and several private clinics cater specifically to expatriates. The Spanish healthcare system is recognized internationally for quality, and EU citizens receive healthcare coverage through the Spanish social security system. Many retirees report that healthcare costs and quality exceed expectations, with prescription medications significantly cheaper than in northern Europe. Emergency services respond quickly, and no area of town is more than 20 minutes from serious medical facilities.

education.text: While primarily appealing to retirees, Guardamar has educational options for visiting family members. El Limonar International School (20 minutes) provides British curriculum education, while the Torrevieja area hosts several international schools with British, American, and Spanish curricula. Local Spanish schools are well-regarded and provide immersion into Spanish culture. Most retirees don't require schools, but grandparents considering longer-term stays appreciate the quality options available within short distances.
keyPoints: El Limonar International School: 20 minutes, British curriculum
Torrevieja schools: Multiple international options, 15-20 minutes away
Local Spanish schools: Strong academic reputations, cultural immersion

shopping.text: Shopping in Guardamar combines convenience with authentic Spanish markets. Mercadona and Consum supermarkets are within walking distance or a 5-minute drive, stocking quality products at reasonable prices. The Wednesday market offers fresh produce, flowers, and local crafts, providing both shopping and community connection. For larger shopping needs, Torrevieja (20 minutes) has major shopping centres with international brands. British food shops and Spanish delicacies are readily available, meaning you can shop for exactly what you want. Prices for groceries are considerably lower than northern Europe.
keyPoints: Mercadona supermarket: Walking distance, excellent variety
Weekly market (Wednesdays): Fresh produce, local atmosphere
Consum supermarket: Convenient locations throughout town
Torrevieja shopping centres: 20 minutes for major retail chains

transport.text: Getting around Guardamar is straightforward. Most town amenities are walkable or a short drive away. Public buses connect to Torrevieja and Alicante, though a car is recommended for independence and flexibility. Alicante-Elche Airport (65 minutes) provides international connections to most European cities, making it simple to receive visiting family and friends. The town has adequate parking, and driving is generally relaxed compared to larger European cities. Public transport costs are minimal, and taxi services are affordable.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €334,500. This 3-bedroom apartment in Guardamar del Segura offers premium specifications at 50% less cost per square metre than comparable properties in nearby Jávea. The property is move-in ready with no renovation required, and flexible payment arrangements may be available for qualified buyers. Additional costs to consider include Spanish property tax (8-11% of purchase price), notary fees, and registration costs—typically totalling €35,000-€45,000.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca is consistently ranked among Europe's top retirement destinations. The region offers exceptional value compared to northern Europe, year-round sunshine, excellent healthcare facilities, a well-established expat community, and a relaxed lifestyle. Guardamar del Segura specifically appeals to retirees seeking authentic Spanish living without overcrowding. Many retirees report that their quality of life improved significantly after moving to the Costa Blanca, with lower living costs, better weather, and greater leisure time.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-residents can purchase property in Spain with no restrictions. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number) and a Spanish bank account. The process is straightforward with professional legal support. Most buyers work with English-speaking solicitors who handle all paperwork, making the process accessible regardless of Spanish language ability. Completion typically takes 6-8 weeks from agreement to final transfer.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: The cost of living in Guardamar del Segura is significantly lower than northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a retired couple typically range from €1,200-€1,800, covering rent/mortgage, utilities, groceries, and dining. Groceries are 30-40% cheaper than UK prices, restaurant meals cost €10-€20, and utilities are minimal due to warm weather. Healthcare through the Spanish system is affordable, and prescription medications cost substantially less than in other European countries.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport, serving the Costa Blanca, is approximately 2.5-3 hours by flight from most major UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham). Budget airlines offer frequent daily flights, typically costing €50-€150 return. The drive to the French coast and onward ferry is feasible for those preferring road travel. Many retirees maintain connections with family and friends through regular flights, while others choose the flexibility of extended stays.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys exceptional weather: 320 days of sunshine annually, warm summers (25-30°C), and mild winters (12-16°C). Rainfall is minimal (200mm annually), and the Mediterranean sea breeze moderates temperatures. Winter never requires central heating, and summers are cooler than inland areas. The weather supports outdoor living year-round, making it ideal for active retirees who enjoy beaches, walking, golf, and outdoor dining.

faqs.question: What rental income can this property generate?
faqs.answer: This 3-bedroom apartment typically generates €700 per week (€2,800 monthly) during peak season, with lower rates in shoulder seasons. Annual rental income could realistically reach €25,000-€35,000 if rented part of the year. Many retirees rent their property during periods they're visiting family in the UK or Europe, generating income while maintaining personal use flexibility. The town's growing popularity with tourists supports consistent rental demand.

faqs.question: Trenger jeg visum for å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: No visa is required specifically to purchase property in Spain. EU citizens have full residency rights under EU freedom of movement. Non-EU buyers can purchase property without restrictions but would need to apply for a residence visa separately if planning to spend more than 180 days annually in Spain. Many retirees obtain the Non-Lucrative Visa (€27,792 annual income requirement), which provides long-term residency for those not working in Spain.

faqs.question: Is Guardamar del Segura family-friendly?
faqs.answer: Yes, Guardamar is excellent for families and multi-generational visits. Blue Flag beaches are safe and well-maintained, with calm waters suitable for children. The town has a relaxed pace, good schools for visiting grandchildren, and numerous family activities including beach days, market exploration, and easy access to theme parks in nearby Benidorm. Visiting family members quickly appreciate the combination of safety, natural beauty, and outdoor activities.

faqs.question: How is the property market performing in Guardamar del Segura?
faqs.answer: The property market in Guardamar del Segura is experiencing healthy growth of approximately 7% year-on-year. The town is increasingly discovered by international buyers seeking value and authentic living away from overcrowded resorts. Prices remain significantly lower than premium Costa Blanca areas like Jávea or Moraira, providing both value for buyers and appreciation potential. The growing rental market supports investment returns for those choosing to rent their properties.
